class_notes:
Topic: "Dreams: Theories of Interpretation and Reflection"Ten meeting periods during the semester, starting Friday, January 26, a week after the normal start of classes, and ending on Friday, April 12. We will not meet the Friday before Spring Break.
Do you often find yourself pondering the vivid stories and images that play out in your dreams? Are you fascinated by the mystery of the mind and curious about possible ways to understand your dreams? In this course on dreams and theories of dream interpretation, we will consider a range of interdisciplinary perspectives. Students will learn tools and strategies for dream analysis and engage in dream discussions. The aim of the course is to develop a more nuanced understanding of the nature of dreams and helpful ways to approach them.  Requirements include light reading and weekly journaling. Prospective students should remember their dreams at least once a week and be willing to share and listen to dreams in class.
course_description: A side-car course brings together a subset of students from two courses that overlap in methodologies, topics, etc., to create a short interdisciplinary course that runs simultaneously with its two sponsoring courses. One credit, S/U only. Schedule and format arranged by sponsoring professors.
